meanings.definition: Make sensitive or aware to a particular stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The workshop on wildlife conservation sensitising the students to the importance of protecting endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise sensitising the baby, causing her to startle and cry.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character was sensitising the audience to the dangers of not wearing a helmet while biking.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody sensitising her emotions, bringing tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The vivid images in the documentary sensitising viewers to the harsh reality of climate change.

meanings.definition: Cause to respond to a stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The teacher sensitising the students to raise their hands when they hear the bell.
meanings.sent2: The smell of freshly baked cookies sensitising her to feel hungry.
meanings.sent3: The magician sensitising the audience to clap whenever he waved his wand.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech sensitising the team to work harder towards their goals.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting sensitising the viewer to feel joy and excitement.
